<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc">GlobalMergeFunc</a> is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulepass">ModulePass</a> that implements a function merging mechanism using stable function hashes. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc/#details">More...</a>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===------ GlobalMergeFunctions.h - Global merge functions -----&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass defines the implementation of a function merging mechanism</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that utilizes a stable function hash to track differences in constants and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// identify potential merge candidates. The process involves two rounds:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 The first round collects stable function hashes and identifies merge</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    candidates with matching hashes. It also computes the set of parameters</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    that point to different constants during the stable function merge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 The second round leverages this collected global function information to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    optimistically create a merged function in each module context, ensuring</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    correct transformation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Similar to the global outliner, this approach uses the linker&#39;s deduplication</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (ICF) to fold identical merged functions, thereby reducing the final binary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// size. The work is inspired by the concepts discussed in the following paper:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://dl.acm.org/doi/pdf/10.1145/3652032.3657575.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;GLOBALMERGEFUNCTIONS&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;GLOBALMERGEFUNCTIONS&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A vector of locations (the pair of (instruction, operand) indices) reachable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// from a parameter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9aa9a17a9fac95f798d0bb107562d7e6"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9aa9a17a9fac95f798d0bb107562d7e6">ParamLocs</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;IndexPair, 4&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A vector of parameters</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GlobalMergeFunc is a ModulePass that implements a function merging mechanism</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// using stable function hashes. It identifies and merges functions with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// matching hashes across modules to optimize binary size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc/#a4e65eb92bb3d24fdabb50564dd6e47c8">GlobalMergeFunc</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a54f7429fa5826ff9909619b76d2bf319">HashFunctionMode</a> MergerMode = <a href="#a54f7429fa5826ff9909619b76d2bf319a509820290d57f333403f490dde7316f4">HashFunctionMode::Local</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;StableFunctionMap&gt; LocalFunctionMap;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the constant values. Note that the original function, without this suffix,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// becomes a thunk supplying contexts to the merged function via parameters.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc/#a8d5bafac1624b2b2608554711a6d05c5"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc/#a8d5bafac1624b2b2608554711a6d05c5">MergingInstanceSuffix</a>&#91;&#93; = </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;.Tgm&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
